snippet: The Food and Drug Administration is advising some blood banks to import blood from regions without an outbreak and certain at-risk donors to delay making a donation.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration unveils new guidelines for blood banks in effort to prevent contamination of nation's blood supply with Zika virus.
lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration is advising some blood banks to import blood from regions without an outbreak and certain at-risk donors to delay making a donation.

headline.main: F.D.A. Issues Zika Virus Guidelines for Blood Supply
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Issues Protocols to Screen Zika Virus From Blood Supply

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
